title: Fed Retools Capital Rules for Largest U.S. Banks
summary: New Fed rule creates capital buffer tied to annual stress tests. WASHINGTON-The Federal Reserve retooled capital rules for the largest U.S. banks, completing one of the biggest changes to the postcrisis rulebook for Wall Street during the Trump administration.

title: Splunk Swings to a Loss, Warns of Weak Sales

title: Biden Surges by Expanding the Democratic Electorate
summary: Presidential candidate is buoyed by suburban voters who flocked to party in 2018; Bernie Sanders concedes 'it isn't easy' to boost youth turnout. Since then, he has completed one of the most dramatic political turnarounds in recent memory with a string of primary wins that showed him to be the only candidate so far to expand the Democratic electorate, a claim that his top rival, Sen. Bernie Sanders, had made for himself.

title: Biden, Sanders Look to Next Contests While Warren Assesses Campaign
summary: Warren assesses campaign after poor performance in 14 states. title: Pentagon Linguist Charged With Providing Secrets to Individual Tied to Hezbollah
summary: Information shared by linguist included real names of individuals spying for the U.S., Justice Department says. title: Recruitment Begins for First Test of Experimental Coronavirus Vaccine
summary: Moderna's shots to undergo a faster-than-expected study on Seattle-area volunteers. summary: Michael LaFontaine ignored internal warnings about the bank's transaction-monitoring software, according to the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network. title: Uncertainty Mounts as Key Surveillance Powers Near Expiration
summary: Intelligence officials warn about risks to national security if surveillance tools are allowed to expire. title: SEC Provides Filing Extension to Companies Affected by Coronavirus
summary: Executives must explain in reports why their companies need the relief, the SEC says. title: Are Those Screens That 'Suggest' 30% Tips Too Pushy?
summary: Tablet-based checkouts in coffee shops make it easy to add a gratuity, but many people feel manipulated into giving too much. WE'VE ALL BEEN THERE-you pick up something as simple as a $3 energy bar or a $5 latte at the counter of your local coffee shop. At checkout, the clerk, someone you see all the time, spins the point-of-sale tablet around to display your tipping options, ranging from a buck to two or even three. You feel bad denying a friendly face but did the clerk's efforts really rise to a level that merits a gratuity, let alone one of 60% or even 100%?

summary: Restaurant chains in U.S., with traffic already stagnant, are adjusting operations as virus gains ground. New York City condo developers are facing a supply overhang and tax changes resulting in greater costs for buyers. But there is one bright spot: an uptick in the number of people around the world who can afford their seven-digit apartments.

title: Curbed by Virus, China's Truckers Can't Wait to Get on the Road Again
summary: Millions of truck drivers are being kept off the road, hampering efforts to get the world's factory moving again. HONG KONG-China has long relied on its 30 million-strong army of truck drivers to keep its economy moving. Now, the coronavirus is keeping half of them off the road.

title: Lego Commits to China Expansion as Revenue Climbs
summary: The toy maker said it will open new stores in China after seeing double-digit sales growth in the country. Lego AS said Wednesday that it will open 150 new stores this year, mostly in China, after opening the same number last year-pushing to meet what it says is that country's growing demand for its toy bricks.

title: The Top Takeaways From Super Tuesday
summary: Democratic presidential primary results showed Joe Biden storming back into the race against Bernie Sanders, while Michael Bloomberg and Elizabeth Warren faltered. LOS ANGELES-Joe Biden's Super Tuesday victories served notice that his triumph in South Carolina was no fluke and could form the basis of a competitive coalition of voters in what is shaping up to be a protracted fight with Sen. Bernie Sanders.

title: Biden Wins the South, Texas; Sanders Takes California
summary: Biden, Sanders pull ahead, setting up a fight for the Democratic nomination. Joe Biden notched an impressive string of Super Tuesday victories, while Bernie Sanders won delegate-rich California, as the pair broke away from the field in the race for the Democratic presidential nomination.

title: Drugmaker Takeda Is Working on Coronavirus Drug
summary: Japanese company plans to develop drug derived from the blood of patients who have antibodies to the virus. Japanese drugmaker Takeda Pharmaceutical Co. said it is trying to develop a drug to treat people infected with the novel coronavirus or at high risk of contracting it.

title: Bloomberg's Massive Super Tuesday Spending Doesn't Pay Dividends
summary: Unprecedented spending couldn't win over voters in Super Tuesday states-and his advisers are now assessing his campaign. WEST PALM BEACH, Fla.-Michael Bloomberg's unprecedented spending couldn't win over voters in Super Tuesday states-and his advisers are assessing his campaign.

title: Democrats Cast Votes in 14 States on Super Tuesday
summary: Former Vice President Joe Biden storms back into the race for the Democratic nomination, going head-to-head against front-runner Bernie Sanders. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: The Biden Resurgence
summary: A very Super Tuesday makes the former Vice President the best Democratic hope to beat Bernie Sanders.. Hold the revolution. The Bernie Sanders takeover of the Democratic Party took a detour on Super Tuesday as Joe Biden's political resurrection that began in South Carolina on Saturday continued in the Southeast and expanded into the Middle West and even Bernie Sanders country in the Northeast. Maybe President Trump wished too soon for Mr. Sanders as his opponent.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Hackers Target Companies With Coronavirus Scams
summary: Phishing emails are used to install malware that can give hackers access to company systems. Criminals are using concerns about the coronavirus epidemic to spread infections of their own.

title: Outbreak Triggers Cruise Cancellations
summary: Cruise operators see surge of cancellations at start of busiest season; another Princess cruise ship struck by virus. Travelers are backing out of planned cruises over fears of the spread of coronavirus, dealing a punishing blow to the industry at a time of year when ships typically start to fill up.

title: U.S. Coronavirus Cases Rise; First Deaths Earlier Than Officials Realized
summary: New cases reported in New York, Arizona, Georgia and North Carolina as nationwide patient tally tops 100. The first deaths linked to the new coronavirus in the U.S. happened last week, days earlier than previously known, as the death count rose and is expected to continue to climb.

title: Elizabeth Warren Loses Primary in Home State of Massachusetts
summary: The Associated Press declared Joe Biden the winner Tuesday. Sen. Elizabeth Warren was poised to place third in Massachusetts' Democratic primary, a blow to the liberal lawmaker's presidential candidacy in a state that sent her to the U.S. Senate twice.

title: Maine Voters Keep Tightened Vaccine Requirements
summary: Ballot measure fails to overturn new immunization law. Maine voters cemented in place a new state law that eliminates nonmedical vaccine exemptions for school children.

title: Coronavirus Misinformation Lives Online, Despite Efforts to Stamp It Out
summary: Tech giants are removing fraudulent content, but some still stokes fear about the virus or circulates unproven information. Facebook Inc. and other technology giants have vowed to fight misinformation related to the coronavirus epidemic on their platforms. Yet even as they remove fraudulent posts, listings and other content, conspiracy theories and false information continue to proliferate online.

title: Democratic Voters Face a Stark Choice From Coast to Coast
summary: Presidential primary voters struggled to choose between calls for pragmatism and sweeping policy changes. RALEIGH, N.C.-Democratic voters from here to California said they struggled to choose between pragmatism and policy on Tuesday, mirroring a national debate over whether sweeping political and economic changes or moderation were the keys to defeating President Trump.

title: The Coronavirus 'Stimulus'
summary: The markets aren't impressed by the Fed or a payroll-tax cut.. The Federal Reserve has become the default doctor for whatever ails the U.S. economy, and on Tuesday the financial physician applied what it hopes will be monetary balm for the economic damage from the coronavirus. Financial markets were underwhelmed after the big rally on Monday, which may speak to the limited effect that lower interest rates can have on the supply shock of a pandemic.

title: Not About Roe v. Wade
summary: The big issue in a Louisiana abortion case is legal standing.. The Supreme Court on Wednesday will hear its first abortion-related case during the Trump Presidency. Cue the consternation. No, the Court's conservatives aren't about to overturn Roe v. Wade. But they do have an opportunity to return to first judicial principles and correct the Court's mistake of four years ago.

title: Israel's Conservative Consensus
summary: Netanyahu beats expectations in the country's third election.. A nationalist leader runs against liberal elites and a rigged system. He's opposed by most of the security establishment, called a threat to democracy, and bombarded with legal investigations and prosecutions. Yet the efforts to use the legal system to oust him fail and even cause his support with voters to tick upward.

title: The Lessons of Idlib
summary: A Russian-Syrian military offensive pushes migrants to the West.. After nine years of civil war, Syria doesn't get much attention these days. But a Russian-Syrian military offensive in Idlib province is a reminder that the broken country's problems seldom stay within its borders.

title: Trump Becomes First U.S. President to Speak With Senior Taliban Leader
summary: An Afghan peace process faces many hurdles-including the resumption of Taliban attacks against Afghan forces this week. WASHINGTON-President Trump said he spoke to the Taliban's co-founder Mullah Abdul Ghani Baradar on Tuesday to discuss the implementation of the deal signed over the weekend to withdraw U.S. troops from Afghanistan, according to statements released afterward.

title: State Funds Ban Staff Travel Over Coronavirus Threat
summary: Some investment professionals will be making virtual visits instead of attending investment advisory board and annual meetings in person. At least two institutional investors have banned international business travel by their investment teams to rein in the threat posed by the Covid-19 coronavirus.
